title: KIM SWITCH / SAMARAN BUTTER
description: Kim asks you what you think might have happened at the canal.

dialogueTree.title: You: ""It looks like someone was in a rea..."
dialogueTree.english: "It looks like someone was in a real hurry."
dialogueTree.polish: „Zdaje się, że komuś się bardzo spieszyło”.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What kind of car do you think it w..."
links.english: "What kind of car do you think it was?"
links.polish: „Jakiego typu auto to według ciebie było?”
links.belarusian: „Які тып аўто, на вашу думку, гэта было?”

links.title: You: ""I think it was a Coupris 40.""
links.english: "I think it was a Coupris 40."
links.polish: „To był chyba Coupris 40”.
links.belarusian: «Гэта, напэўна, быў Coupris 40».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He seems impressed. "That's quite l..."
links.english: He seems impressed. "That's quite likely, from what I can tell."
links.polish: Wydaje się być pod wrażeniem. „Tak, według mnie to całkiem prawdopodobne”.
links.belarusian: Ён, здаецца, уражаны. «Так, на мой погляд, гэта цалкам верагодна».

links.title: You: ""I believe it was a Linnea G22.""
links.english: "I believe it was a Linnea G22."
links.polish: „Myślę, że to była Linnea G22”.
links.belarusian: «Думаю, што гэта была Linnea G22».

links.title: You: ""I have no idea.""
links.english: "I have no idea."
links.polish: „Nie mam pojęcia”.
links.belarusian: «Я не маю паняцця».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose it's not really our job..."
links.english: "I suppose it's not really our job to figure that out."
links.polish: „Właściwie ustalanie tego nie należy do naszych obowiązków”.
links.belarusian: «Уласна кажучы, вызначэнне гэтага ня ўваходзіць у нашы абавязкі».

links.title: You: ""I have some ideas about who it mig..."
links.english: "I have some ideas about who it might have been."
links.polish: „Chyba wiem, kto to mógł zrobić”.
links.belarusian: «Мабыць, я ведаю, хто мог гэта зрабіць».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He raises his eyebrows. "Oh?""
links.english: He raises his eyebrows. "Oh?"
links.polish: Unosi brwi. „Tak?”
links.belarusian: Падымае бровы. «Так?»

links.title: You: ""It had to be someone really cool a..."
links.english: "It had to be someone really cool and courageous."
links.polish: „To musiał być ktoś naprawdę czadowy i odważny”.
links.belarusian: «Гэта павінен быў быць сапраўды круты і адважны чалавек».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose that narrows it down som..."
links.english: "I suppose that narrows it down somewhat. Fortunately, we're not traffic cops. Should we get back to the murder?"
links.polish: „To zawęża w jakimś stopniu krąg podejrzanych. Na szczęście nie jesteśmy funkcjonariuszami drogówki. Możemy zająć się na powrót naszym morderstwem?”
links.belarusian: «Гэта ў нейкай ступені звужае кола падазраваных. На шчасце, мы не з'яўляемся супрацоўнікамі дарожнай службы. Можам вярнуцца да нашага забойства?»

links.title: You: ""It was someone dangerous. Perhaps..."
links.english: "It was someone dangerous. Perhaps this is somehow *connected* to the murder?"
links.polish: „To musiał być ktoś niebezpieczny. Może *wiąże się* to jakoś z morderstwem?”
links.belarusian: «Гэта павінен быў быць хтосьці небяспечны. Можа, гэта нейкім чынам звязана з забойствам?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The traffic hooliganism? I hope no..."
links.english: "The traffic hooliganism? I hope not. Fortunately, we're not traffic cops. Should we get back to the murder?"
links.polish: „Piractwo drogowe? Mam nadzieję, że nie – nie jesteśmy funkcjonariuszami drogówki. Możemy zająć się na powrót naszym morderstwem?”
links.belarusian: «Дарожнае пірацтва? Спадзяюся, што не — мы ж не супрацоўнікі ДАІ. Можам заняцца нашым забойствам?»

links.title: You: ""Actually, never mind, I need more..."
links.english: "Actually, never mind, I need more evidence to come up with a list of suspects."
links.polish: „Właściwie to nieważne. Potrzebuję więcej dowodów, żeby opracować listę podejrzanych”.
links.belarusian: «Сапраўды, гэта не важна. Мне трэба больш доказаў, каб распрацаваць спіс падазраваных».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We're not traffic cops. Should we..."
links.english: "We're not traffic cops. Should we get back to the murder?"
links.polish: „Nie jesteśmy funkcjonariuszami drogówki. Możemy zająć się na powrót naszym morderstwem?”
links.belarusian: «Мы не з'яўляемся супрацоўнікамі дарожнай паліцыі. Можам вярнуцца да нашага забойства?»

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I have no idea. Who could it..."
links.english: "Yeah, I have no idea. Who could it have been?"
links.polish: „Tak, nie mam pojęcia. Kto mógł to zrobić?”
links.belarusian: «Так, не маю паняцця. Хто мог гэта зрабіць?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shrugs. "We're not t..."
links.english: The lieutenant shrugs. "We're not traffic cops. Should we get back to the murder?"
links.polish: Porucznik wzrusza ramionami. „Nie jesteśmy funkcjonariuszami drogówki. Możemy zająć się na powrót naszym morderstwem?”
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант паціскае плячыма. «Мы не супрацоўнікі дарожнай інспекцыі. Можам зноў заняцца нашым забойствам?»

links.title: You: "Try to come up with a convincing ex..."
links.english: Try to come up with a convincing explanation for the driver's actions.
links.polish: Spróbuj wymyślić przekonujące wyjaśnienie, co mogło nakłonić kierowcę do działania.
links.belarusian: Паспрабуйце прыдумаць пераканаўчае тлумачэнне, што магло прымусіць кіроўцу дзейнічаць.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Somewhere in the depths of your alc..."
links.english: Somewhere in the depths of your alcohol-addled soul, you find a few threads that you can weave into a story.
links.polish: Gdzieś w głębi swojej nasiąkniętej alkoholem duszy znajdujesz kilka wątków, które możesz spleść w historię.
links.belarusian: Недзе ў глыбіні сваёй насычанай алкаголем душы знаходзіш некалькі нітак, якія можаш сплесці ў гісторыю.

links.title: You: ""This could have only been..." (Pau..."
links.english: "This could have only been..." (Pause dramatically.) "... Jacob Irw."
links.polish: „To mógł być tylko...” (Zrób dramatyczną przerwę). „Jacob Irw”.
links.belarusian: «Гэта мог быць толькі...» (Зрабіць драматычную паўзу). «Якаў Ірв».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The TipTop Tournée champion?""
links.english: "The TipTop Tournée champion?"
links.polish: „Mistrz TipTop Tournée?”
links.belarusian: «Майстар ТыпТоп Турнэ?»

links.title: You: ""After the untimely death of dear f..."
links.english: "After the untimely death of dear friend and fellow racer Alfie Deletraz at Fjordhammer, Jacob Irw was desperately chasing death on the race track -- but death *eluded* him."
links.polish: „Po tym, jak Jacob Irw utracił przedwcześnie w Fjordhammer swojego drogiego przyjaciela, również kierowcę, Alfiego Deletraza, zaczął desperacko gonić na torach wyścigowych śmierć. Ona jednak *nie dawała* się doścignąć”.
links.belarusian: «Пасля таго, як Джэйкаб Ірв перадчасова страціў у Ф'ёрдхамеры свайго дарагога сябра, таксама гоншчыка, Альфі Дэлетраза, ён пачаў адчайна пераследваць смерць на гоначных трасах. Аднак яна *не дазваляла* сябе дагнаць».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant patiently listens to..."
links.english: The lieutenant patiently listens to the words coming from your mouth.
links.polish: Porucznik cierpliwie wysłuchuje słów, które wydobywają się z twoich ust.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант цярпліва слухае словы, якія вырываюцца з тваіх вуснаў.

links.title: You: ""After quitting in frustration, he..."
links.english: "After quitting in frustration, he became a recluse, a ghost-driver, searching for death on the streets of Revachol, speeding..."
links.polish: „Po tym, jak sfrustrowany zrezygnował, został pustelnikiem, kierowcą duchem, szukającym śmierci na ulicach Revacholu, po których pędził z ogromną prędkością...”
links.belarusian: «Пасля таго, як расчараваны ён звольніўся, стаў пустэльнікам, кіроўцам-прывідзінам, які шукае смерць на вуліцах Рэвачола, па якіх імчаў з велізарнай хуткасцю...»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... jumping canals at night?" He i..."
links.english: "... jumping canals at night?" He interrupts you. "If I was Jacob Irw I wouldn't drive in *Martinaise*. The roads are awful."
links.polish: „...przeskakując nocą kanały?” – przerywa ci. „Gdybym był Jacobem Irwem, to nie jeździłbym po *Martinaise*. Tutejsze drogi są okropne”.
links.belarusian: „...пераскокваючы ноччу па каналах?” – перарывае цябе. „Каб я быў Якабам Ірвам, я б не ездзіў па *Martinaise*. Мясцовыя дарогі тут жахлівыя”.

links.title: Authority: "Shut *down*."
links.english: Shut *down*.
links.polish: *Zgaszony*.
links.belarusian: *Пагашаны*.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In conclusion -- it's a colourful..."
links.english: "In conclusion -- it's a colourful theory, but I don't believe Jacob Irw did this. Should we go?"
links.polish: „Podsumowując: to barwna hipoteza, ale nie wierzę, aby to był Jacob Irw. Idziemy?”
links.belarusian: «Падсумоўваючы: гэта маляўнічая гіпотэза, але не веру, што гэта быў Джэйкаб Ірў. Ідзем?»

links.title: Conceptualization: "You've thought of a very touching s..."
links.english: You've thought of a very touching story. It's shit, though.
links.polish: Wymyśliłeś bardzo poruszającą historię. Niestety, jest też gówniana.
links.belarusian: Ты прыдумаў вельмі кранальную гісторыю. На жаль, яна таксама дрэнная.

links.title: You: "That's okay, I love shit stories."
links.english: That's okay, I love shit stories.
links.polish: Nie szkodzi, uwielbiam gówniane historie.
links.belarusian: Не бяда, я люблю дурацкія гісторыі.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Well, you're in luck, then."
links.english: Well, you're in luck, then.
links.polish: No to ci się poszczęściło.
links.belarusian: Ну што ж, табе пашанцавала.

links.title: You: ""See, Kim, what happened here is --..."
links.english: "See, Kim, what happened here is -- the driver was a man whose wife was about to give birth..."
links.polish: „Widzisz, Kim, było tak, że żona kierowcy zaczęła rodzić...”
links.belarusian: «Ведаеш, Кім, было так, што жонка кіроўцы пачала нараджаць...»

links.title: Conceptualization: "Yes, this is good, this is very goo..."
links.english: Yes, this is good, this is very good.
links.polish: Tak, dobrze. To jest naprawdę dobre.
links.belarusian: Так, добра. Гэта сапраўды добра.

links.title: Rhetoric: "No, it's shit."
links.english: No, it's shit.
links.polish: Nie, to gówno.
links.belarusian: Не, гэта лайно.

links.title: You: ""He was out drinking with his pals..."
links.english: "He was out drinking with his pals when he got the news, and, flushed with paternal pride, he got into his Coupris at once and raced to the clinic..."
links.polish: „Pił właśnie z kumplami, kiedy dotarła do niego wiadomość, i, pędzony ojcowską dumą, wsiadł natychmiast do swojego couprisa i popędził do szpitala...”
links.belarusian: «Ён якраз піў з прыяцелямі, калі да яго дайшла вестка, і, рухомы бацькоўскім гонар ас, адразу сеў у свой купрыс і памчаў у шпіталь...»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, yes, that could very well hav..."
links.english: "Yes, yes, that could very well have been it. Now let's move on. We're not traffic cops."
links.polish: „Tak, tak – tak właśnie mogło być. Dajmy już temu spokój. Nie pracujemy w drogówce”.
links.belarusian: «Так, так — так менавіта гэта магло быць. Давайце пакінем гэта ў спакоі. Мы не працуем у дарожнай інспекцыі».

links.title: You: "Maybe I shouldn't tell it if it's s..."
links.english: Maybe I shouldn't tell it if it's shit.
links.polish: Skoro jest gówniana, to może nie powinienem jej opowiadać?
links.belarusian: Калі яно дрэннае, дык, магчыма, мне не варта ёй расказваць?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Nope, you're already telling it."
links.english: Nope, you're already telling it.
links.polish: Za późno. Już ją opowiadasz.
links.belarusian: Занадта позна. Ты ўжо расказваеш яе.

links.title: Volition: "The urge is strong, but you are str..."
links.english: The urge is strong, but you are stronger.
links.polish: Pokusa jest silna, ale ty – silniejszy.
links.belarusian: Спакуса моцная, але ты – мацнейшы.

links.title: You: ""No, we need to find this Jacob Irw..."
links.english: "No, we need to find this Jacob Irw before tragedy strikes." (Take the task.)
links.polish: „Nie, musimy znaleźć tego Jacoba Irwa, zanim dojdzie do tragedii”. (Przyjmij zadanie).
links.belarusian: «Не, мы павінны знайсці гэтага Джэйкаба Ірва, перш чым адбудзецца трагедыя». (Прымай заданне).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He sighs. "If we must.""
links.english: He sighs. "If we must."
links.polish: Wzdycha. „Jeśli musimy”.
links.belarusian: Уздыхае. «Калі трэба».

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I'm not expecting him to get far wi..."
links.english: I'm not expecting him to get far with this, the lieutenant consoles himself.
links.polish: Nie sądzę, żeby daleko w tym zaszedł – pociesza sam siebie porucznik.
links.belarusian: Я не думаю, што ён дасягне ў гэтым вялікага поспеху, – суцяшае сам сябе лейтэнант.

links.title: You: ""We should bring this driver to jus..."
links.english: "We should bring this driver to justice." (Take the task.)
links.polish: „Kierowca powinien zostać stosownie ukarany”. (Przyjmij zadanie).
links.belarusian: «Кіроўца павінен быць адпаведна пакараны».

links.title: You: ""On second thought, maybe this does..."
links.english: "On second thought, maybe this doesn't really warrant an investigation." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Właściwie to może jednak nie wymaga to śledztwa”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: «На самой справе, можа быць, гэта і не патрабуе расследавання». [Адыдзі].

links.title: You: ""Let's move on. We've learned all w..."
links.english: "Let's move on. We've learned all we can here." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Chodźmy stąd. Dowiedzieliśmy się wszystkiego, czego mogliśmy”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: „Пайшлі адсюль. Мы даведаліся ўсяго, што маглі”. [Сыходзіць].

dialogueTree.title: You: ""Some top-shelf shenanigans. I want..."
dialogueTree.english: "Some top-shelf shenanigans. I want to meet the driver and shake his hand."
dialogueTree.polish: „No, wygłupy z najwyższej półki. Chcę poznać kierowcę i uścisnąć mu dłoń”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: «Ну, выкрунтасы самага высокага класа. Хачу пазнаёміцца з кіроўцам і паціснуць яму руку».

dialogueTree.title: You: ""I don't care and it's not really o..."
dialogueTree.english: "I don't care and it's not really our concern." [Leave.]
dialogueTree.polish: „Nie obchodzi mnie to, zresztą to nie nasza sprawa”. [Odejdź].
dialogueTree.belarusian: «Мяне гэта не цікавіць, дарэчы, гэта не наша справа». [Адыдзі].

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right." He straightens his..."
links.english: "You're right." He straightens his back. "Let's get back to the murder investigation."
links.polish: „Masz rację” – prostuje się. „Wracajmy do naszego śledztwa w sprawie morderstwa”.
links.belarusian: «Ты маеш рацыю», – выпраўляецца. «Вяртаемся да нашага расследавання па справе забойства».
